intro: Phanera kunthiana, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Phanera kunthiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in garden settings.
